places.generalDescription: York Minster, also known as The Cathedral and Metropolitical Church of Saint Peter in York, is a magnificent Gothic cathedral with impressive stained-glass windows. Visitors can explore the interactive Undercroft exhibition to learn about the cathedral's history and construction. Tower tours are available for those who want to climb up and enjoy breathtaking views of the city.

sources.snippet: If you ask me, there‚Äôs never a bad time to visit York Minster. Whether you‚Äôre there for the history or the gorgeous architecture  (I really recommend doing the guided tour if you‚Äôre interested in either of these things), anyone and everyone can find something to appreciate about this glorious building. But if you want to take your experience up a notch or two, I‚Äôd advise you to see it as few people get to see it‚Äìby candlelight.
sources.shortName: 15+ Things to Do in York for Couples (That You Actually Want to Do)

sources.snippet: A masterpiece of Gothic architecture, York Minster stands proudly as one of the largest cathedrals in Northern Europe. Its intricate design and awe-inspiring presence make it a top attraction for both locals and tourists. York romantic activities wouldn‚Äôt be complete without taking in the stunning stained glass windows that narrate biblical stories, some of which date back to the 12th century.
sources.shortName: 15 Unforgettable Things to Do in York for Couples

sources.snippet: Majestic and imposing, York Minster is the largest Gothic cathedral north of the Alps. Did any building in Britain ever inspire such feelings from the heart as this architectural masterpiece?. The Duke of Kent married Miss Katherine Worsley here in June 1961; this was the first Royal wedding in York Minster since King Edward III married Philippa of Hainault there in 1328.
sources.shortName: Romantic York
14 Romantic Things to do in York for Couples (2024 Guide)

sources.snippet: This proudly one of the most Gothic cathedrals in Northern Europe. Taking 250 years this build this iconic landmark, the York Minster stands proudly in the centre of York and is not one to miss with the camera and his will always on the list for top things to do. If you‚Äôre looking for unique and unusual places to go in York, then you should check this out!
sources.shortName: 25 BEST THINGS TO DO YORK (And Unusual) 2022 Tourist Attactions

sources.snippet: If ascending the stairs of Clifford‚Äôs Tower didn‚Äôt thrill you enough, another romantic idea is to discover the most renowned building in York ‚Äì the Minster. First built in the 7 th century, the Minster is a huge, stunning cathedral, found at the centre of the city. It boasts awe-inspiring architecture on the outside and beautiful details on the inside.
sources.shortName: 10 Most Romantic Things to Do in York for Couples [2024]

sources.snippet: There are the well-known attractions, such as the gorgeous Gothic cathedral, York Minster, the Roman period bathhouses, and the Snickleways, where you can get lost wandering the winding medieval alleys. There are also some more modern must-dos, such as a sunset river cruise, shopping in Stonegate and dining at any of York‚Äôs award-winning restaurants.
sources.shortName: What to do on a romantic getaway to York

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôre looking for a peaceful escape from the busy city, York Minster is the perfect spot for couples to explore. A local legend suggests couples should share a kiss beneath the Great West Window, also known as the ‚ÄúHeart of Yorkshire‚Äù, due to its intricate heart-shaped stone tracery. They say that if you do so, you‚Äôll stay together forever.
sources.shortName: Things To Do In York For Couples

sources.snippet: You can see the towers stretching high from almost every street. But you still can‚Äôt fail to be impressed when you finally reach the minster and really take in the sheer scale of the building ‚Äì no matter how many times you have seen it!. The minster is blessed with the quiet and reflective aura that surrounds many churches.
sources.shortName: 15 Romantic Things to do in York for Couples

sources.snippet: From Kings Staith Landings, many companies (such as City Cruises) offer the chance to self-drive one of their lovely boats along the River Ouse. Along your journey, you will have a chance to take in the sights of York‚Äôs historic skyline. Millennium Bridge and Clifford‚Äôs Tower being two of the best sights you will see.
sources.shortName: 15 BEST things to do in York for couples in 2024

sources.snippet: York Minster is the biggest medieval cathedral in Northern Europe, and considered to be one of the world‚Äôs most beautiful Gothic buildings. It took over 250 years to build and the craftsmanship is breathtaking; you can‚Äôt help but stare and wonder about how they managed its construction nearly 900 years ago.
sources.shortName: 16 VERY BEST Things to do in York, England (2023)

sources.snippet: York Minster is a stunning cathedral that dates back to the 7th century. It‚Äôs one of the largest Gothic cathedrals in Europe, and it‚Äôs a sight to behold. When you visit, be sure to take a guided tour to learn about the history of the cathedral and the city of York.
sources.shortName: Things to Do in York for Couples for a Romantic Getaway

sources.snippet: York Minster is that towering masterpiece of Gothic architecture that you‚Äôll have seen plenty of times no doubt. But if you go with your date then you might actually realise how romantic and beautiful it is. It‚Äôs got stained glass windows and low lighting.
sources.shortName: 26 fun and romantic things to do in York for couples

sources.snippet: There are plenty of things to do for couples in this romantic city. With historic buildings, cosy pubs and intriguing museums, you‚Äôll be spoiled for choice. The historic centre of York is compact and you can easily get around on foot.
sources.shortName: The Most Romantic Things to Do in York for Couples (2025)

sources.snippet: For instance, if you visit York Minster, see if you can spot the ‚ÄúHeart of Yorkshire‚Äù. Clue - it‚Äôs worked into the design of the Great West Window. Legend has it that couples that kiss beneath the heart will stay together forever.

places.name: York Minster

reviews.text: Five stars isn't enough. It may be the best, definitely one of the best churches I've ever seen. Not overloaded with iconography but if history for sure. Everything about the place makes you feel good to be alive. So awesome inspiring to be here, especially when the organ is playing or when the choir is singing. Spent four hours here and have seen everything but could spend a few more looking at details and such. Reading all the information bulletins takes a while. Staff are so nice and friendly too. Everyone in a good mood throughout the church.

Oh my, this building is one magnificent üòç piece of architecture. The photos and videos don't do it any justice.  I just hope to have seen it on a better day. The building is under repairs, I'm not quite sure what they are doing.  It looked like the work involved the repair of all the carvings on the building (restoration and improvement). Many of the stone carvings were quite degraded. Even so, the building was remarkable to see. Sadly, we didn't have enough time to experience it entirely. We didn't get to go inside nor enjoy the gardens. I would definitely recommend it, so peaceful even with all the construction works going on.

There is no parking on the site, we found it best to park at margate car park next to the museum gardens. Lots of parking spaces, and u will enjoy walking through the city on your way to the Minster. It's very expensive, though üòï as is everywhere else in York.

York Minster is breathtaking and full of history. The architecture is stunning, especially the stained glass windows and the grand interior. It's peaceful inside, perfect for reflection, and you can really feel the sense of heritage. A must-visit landmark when in York.

places.address: Deangate, York, YO1 7HH, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: The National Railway Museum in York is a treasure trove of railway history and artifacts, featuring an impressive collection of over 300 vehicles, including the famous steam world record holder, the Mallard. Housed in the city's former train depot, this museum boasts the UK's largest collection of trains and rail-related memorabilia.

sources.snippet: Step in the National Railway Museum for free and journey through the evolution of railways. Housing legendary locomotives and a testament to engineering genius, this museum is a tribute to the timeless innovation of the railways. Dive deep into the tales of the people, places and marvels that shaped the tracks, as they bring stories to life.
sources.shortName: Things to Do in York for Couples: A Romantic Getaway

sources.snippet: The best thing about finding your soulmate is being able to share the most random of interests with each other. And even if you‚Äôve never once in your life thought that trains could be cool ‚Äì think again. If you‚Äôre looking for things to do in York for couples that‚Äôll keep you occupied for a few hours, head to York Railway Museum.
sources.shortName: 15+ Things to Do in York for Couples (That You Actually Want to Do)
14 Romantic Things to do in York for Couples (2024 Guide)

sources.snippet: Even if you don‚Äôt geek out over trains, York‚Äôs National Railway Museum, which houses more than 100 locomotives, is so well presented that most will find it interesting. Famous trains you can see include the record-breaking Mallard and the only Shinkansen bullet train you‚Äôll find outside of Japan.
sources.shortName: 16 VERY BEST Things to do in York, England (2023)
Romantic York

places.name: National Railway Museum York

reviews.text: A great afternoon. Free to enter but suggest a donation. Beautifully restored trains from the steam and electric eras. Plenty to look at and a huge room at the back with massive collection of rail memorabilia. Two cafes, one serves food and drinks the other ice cream and drinks. Good number of seating for the cafe, with other places to sit, eat, drink or just to relax. There's a model railway and a couple of gift shops too.

Fantastic place to visit. Car park undergoing refurbishment so places at a premium.  Good support for wheelchair users.  Only negative is having to book a slot online, even though it's free entry. Bit of a contract that the entry is free but the car park is ¬£10. I told the receptionist we had a blue badge so she gave me a free ticket for the car park, but they don't advertise this.

An absolute must visit! We spent a cracking few hours enjoying the trains here. Everything is clearly well looked after and there's plenty of signage to orientate yourself with your surroundings. Despite being the tail end of the Summer holidays, it wasn't too busy. It was easy to park at the park and ride and get the bus in. After visiting the museum, it's an easy wander into the city.

places.address: Leeman Rd, York, YO26 4XJ, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Step into the world of the Vikings at Jorvik Viking Centre, where you can explore a fully reconstructed Viking village and immerse yourself in the sights, sounds, and even smells of AD975. Located on the site of the famous Coppergate Dig, this museum offers a unique experience with interactive exhibits and an immersive ride through recreated Viking streets. Discover Norse mythology, Viking history, and a fascinating collection of artifacts including fossilized human poo.

sources.snippet: The Jorvik Viking Centre is built on one of the most famous discoveries of modern archaelogy. In the late 1970s archaeologists uncovered the houses, workshops and backyards of the Viking city of Jorvik as it was nearly 1000 years ago. A trip to the Centre takes you on a journey through the reconstructed Viking-age streets so you can experience life as it would have been in the 10th century.
sources.shortName: 7 Things To Do In York For Couples

sources.snippet: The Jorvik Viking Centre is an interactive museum that tells the story of York‚Äôs Viking past. Visitors can explore a recreated Viking village, learn about Viking artifacts, and even experience a ride through a Viking street. It‚Äôs a fun and educational experience for visitors of all ages.
sources.shortName: Things to Do in York for Couples for a Romantic Getaway

sources.snippet: In the 1970s, excavations uncovered a Viking settlement beneath the streets. The site of that settlement now houses Jorvik (the Viking name for York), an interactive exhibition that brings to life the 9th-century village.
sources.shortName: 16 VERY BEST Things to do in York, England (2023)

places.name: JORVIK Viking Centre

reviews.text:
Incredible!! Highly highly recommend! The centre is built on actual archaeological excavation site and you can see real remnants of things found during the excavation. The ride is fun and the people working there are incredibly informed and friendly.

You have to book in advance as only limited number of people are allowed in at each time slot. Even on weekdays they get booked up:)

One feedback I would give is it'd be much more find if they had a dressing up section and place to take pictures:D otherwise perfect!

The viking centre was very interesting. The kids loved the ride going through the viking street and holding some viking weapons. We got to watch them stamp some coins and the kids were able to play some viking games.
The people working there are all great entertainment. Very funny and knowledgeable.
You only need a couple of hours to walk through so it is a worth the visit.

A brilliant mix of fun and history. The Jorvik Viking Centre isn't your average museum-you're taken on a ride through a recreated Viking village, complete with lifelike figures, sounds, and even smells (yes, including a latrine). It's surprisingly immersive and gives you a real sense of what life might have been like in 10th-century York.

The highlight is definitely the ride, but the exhibition afterwards is packed with genuine artefacts found right on that site. It's all well presented and easy to engage with, even if you're not a history buff. Staff are friendly, knowledgeable, and dressed in costume, which adds to the atmosphere.

It's not a long visit-around an hour-but it's packed with detail and charm. Great for families, and still interesting enough for adults going solo. Not cheap, but worth it for the experience. Book ahead to avoid disappointment.

places.address: 19 Coppergate, York, YO1 9WT, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Betty's Caf√© Tea Rooms is a renowned traditional tearoom that has been serving the people of York since 1936. Established by Swiss baker Fritz Butzer, it offers a choice between formal afternoon teas and casual cafe dining with British fare. The tearoom's interior was inspired by the Queen Mary ocean liner, providing an elegant setting for indulging in their famous Lady Betty Afternoon Tea.

sources.snippet: A visit to York is incomplete without experiencing the delightful tradition of afternoon tea, and Betty‚Äôs Caf√© Tea Rooms is the epitome of this British custom. Nestled in the heart of the city, couples can savour handcrafted pastries, dainty sandwiches, and a variety of teas in an elegant setting reminiscent of the early 20th century. The vintage charm of the tea room, combined with the rich flavours of their offerings, makes it a top pick for couples seeking to indulge in York couples getaway experiences.
sources.shortName: 15 Unforgettable Things to Do in York for Couples

sources.snippet: Afternoon tea in York is a must for all travellers who have been on their feet all day and fancy a good ‚Äò ol cuppa. The famous Betty‚Äôs tea room is probably the best and most visited places in York for a piece of cake and a tea or coffee. This famous cafe is known for outstanding tea, coffees, lunch and best of all, the cakes.
sources.shortName: 25 BEST THINGS TO DO YORK (And Unusual) 2022 Tourist Attactions

sources.snippet: Or head to the classic Betty‚Äôs Cafe Tea Rooms where you can get a traditional afternoon tea, complete with one of its famous fat rascal scones ‚Äì it‚Äôs a cross between a scone and a rock cake, and is seriously delicious!. There‚Äôs also an afternoon tea cruise.
sources.shortName: 16 VERY BEST Things to do in York, England (2023)

sources.snippet: Ok we know that Betty‚Äôs makes all our list of things to do in York. It‚Äôs because it‚Äôs famous. And it‚Äôs just that good.
sources.shortName: 26 fun and romantic things to do in York for couples

places.name: Bettys Caf√© Tea Rooms York

reviews.text: We had a wonderful and memorable experience at Betty's in the Belmont room. I love treating my Auntie to afternoon tea here for a yearly tradition. Thank you to Eva for being so warm, friendly and attentive on our special day. And thank you for bearing with me whilst I fussed over my auntie's gluten free food!! We were in safe hands and the food and drinks were as wonderful as they always are.

Our family had a fantastic afternoon tea at Betty Tea Room in York! We queued for 15 minutes at the entrance-totally worth it. Ordered two afternoon tea sets, a burger, a rosite, and a salad. The portions were huge (way beyond expectations) but everything tasted amazing. The elegant decor and professional service (staff in suits even took photos for us!) made it a perfect experience. Highly recommended!

Betty's is a lovely place to eat. It's very welcoming. The staff are so friendly and helpful. The cake prices are high and the portions are small. As I'm a tourist I ordered a rascal since I've never heard of them before. Turned out to be the most comical and lovable cake I've ever seen (and I did enjoy it too). I would come again to get the afternoon tea. Be prepared to queue outside and spend inside. It still manages to be a nice experience. And ignore my photo of the rascal as it's not typical of what the food looks like.

places.address: 6-8 St. Helen‚Äôs Square, York, YO1 8QP, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: House Of The Trembling Madness // Stonegate (The Original) is a unique medieval bar with stuffed animal heads adorning the walls. The ground-floor off-licence offers an impressive selection of over 600 beers, while upstairs, in a 12th-century Norman house, is one of Britain's most idiosyncratic beer bars.

sources.snippet: The House of Trembling Madness on Stonegate sits above a beer shop of the same name. It is an original medieval ale house; think long benches, real ale and beamed ceilings. It is a unique thing to do in York for couples.
sources.shortName: 21 romantic things to do in York

places.name: House Of The Trembling Madness // Stonegate (The Original)

reviews.text:
Part medieval apothecary, part beer lover's paradise! The bottle shop downstairs is stocked with an incredible selection of craft beers, ciders, and spirits from around the world. Whether you're after a rare Belgian ale, a bold IPA, or something completely new, they've got you covered.

Upstairs, the quirky tavern feels like stepping into a Viking mead hall with its rustic charm, taxidermy, and candlelit tables. Perfect for sipping on a unique brew or enjoying their delicious food.

The staff are always happy to recommend something exciting. If you love great beer, history, or just a fantastic pub experience.

Cheers!

To enter the pub you need to enter the store and then go upstairs. The staff is super nice and welcoming. They saw us discussing whether we should climb the stairs with the suitcase, and they offered to take it into their storage room. The bar has very interesting interior and cool view (see the pictures). The soup was really nice, as well as the bread and the butter we got alongside. I liked the music. The only minus is that the surface of the table wasn't smooth, so I was holding my beer most of the time.

Fabulous place and hidden in a shop but when you get upstairs it really is unique. A large variety of beers and ales to choose from - listed by country, which was impressive. Decor is fantastic.
Great atmosphere and lovely staff. Definitely worth a visit when in York.
Great shop too, so much choice in miniatures! Awesome idea!!

places.address: 48 Stonegate, York, YO1 8AS, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Museum Gardens, located around the Yorkshire Museum, offer a blend of history and natural beauty. The museum itself houses collections covering archaeology, biology, astronomy, and geology with artifacts from the Viking and Roman periods. It also hosts workshops for children and community programs for adults. The botanical gardens boast a variety of trees, bulbs, and shrubs perfect for scenic walks or peaceful retreats.

sources.snippet: While the Yorkshire Museum is definitely worth a visit, it‚Äôs the Museum Gardens which really take our fancy. This idyllic haven is bursting with interesting plant species, wildlife, and historical features, making for one of the most romantic settings imaginable. Located within the gardens is the Edible Wood, a garden designed around permaculture and forest gardening, as well as the exploration of our relationship with food and crop production.
sources.shortName: Lovely Things to Do in York for Couples

sources.snippet: When your free time or funds are low, take a step back and remember that it‚Äôs the quality of time spent together that matters - and that‚Äôs true wherever you are. Luckily, there are plenty of places you can visit in York for free - and for me, my favourite place will always be outside in York‚Äôs abundant nature. York Museum Gardens offers a beautifully maintained and peaceful retreat from the city's hustle and bustle.
sources.shortName: 15+ Things to Do in York for Couples (That You Actually Want to Do)

sources.snippet: Museum Gardens, spread over 10 acres, offers a tranquil oasis right in the heart of York. As couples wander through the well-manicured gardens, they‚Äôre treated to a beautiful blend of botanical beauty and historical artefacts. From the medieval ruins of St. Mary‚Äôs Abbey to the picturesque landscapes housing a variety of plant species, it‚Äôs an ideal place for relaxation and romance.
sources.shortName: 15 Unforgettable Things to Do in York for Couples

sources.snippet: The Museum Gardens are beside the River Ouse and are perfect for a picnic date in York (again‚Ä¶weather dependent). It‚Äôs quite relaxing to sit here and eat food together, all next to the ruins of St. Mary‚Äôs Abbey. The gardens also provide a picturesque backdrop for romantic and Instagrammable photos, making it a memorable spot if you want to spend quality time together.
sources.shortName: 26 fun and romantic things to do in York for couples

sources.snippet: The York museum gardens are a stunning lush environment that you can easily spend a few hours wandering around the amazing grounds. The gardens are easy to get to as they‚Äôre in the centre or York next to the River Ouse. Furthermore, the York museum gardens are over 100 years old and were created by the Yorkshire Museum and the Yorkshire Philosophical Society.
sources.shortName: 25 BEST THINGS TO DO YORK (And Unusual) 2022 Tourist Attactions

sources.snippet: Experience a delightful day out in York‚Äôs museum gardens, open from 9am to 6pm with no entry fee. Nestled within these gardens is the Yorkshire Museum, boasting some of Europe‚Äôs most significant archaeological treasures. For couples seeking a serene escape, pack a picnic and relish a romantic meal amidst this picturesque backdrop with your loved one.
sources.shortName: Things to Do in York for Couples: A Romantic Getaway

sources.snippet: The Yorkshire Museum is worth checking out, but we highly recommend strolling through the Museum Gardens. This place is a true paradise with its diverse plant species, fascinating wildlife, and rich history. The Edible Wood is a must-see, designed to explore our connection with food and crop production through permaculture and forest gardening.
sources.shortName: Things To Do In York For Couples

sources.snippet: Grab a picnic from a nearby supermarket and head to York Museum Gardens for a stroll around the stunning botanical gardens, before settling down to enjoy your food and sweet treat for dessert.
sources.shortName: 15 BEST things to do in York for couples in 2024
21 romantic things to do in York

places.name: Museum Gardens

reviews.text: I've often enjoyed  a stroll or a picnic in these beautiful gardens on my frequent visits to York. They were especially beautiful on my latest spring visit, when they were filled with colourful tulips and tree blossom. Located just outside the city walls, close to Bootham Bar and the Minster, they have lots of grassy space for children to run and play in, well tended flowerbeds, a lovely rock garden, and a riverside walk with a convenient exit to the riverbank and cruises. They're also rich in history, with some evocative Roman and medieval ruins. In the Middle Ages, these gardens were the grounds of St Mary's Abbey, which rivalled the Minster in size and grandeur until it was dissolved in the 16th century. Its ruins are still impressive, and I've seen them used as a backdrop for wedding photos. There's also an observatory containing a refractor telescope, but I've never actually seen it open for visits. It's well worth spending a couple of hours in the museum. There are lots of benches and a picnic area, but no toilets; the nearest ones are a 5 minute walk away at Bootham Bar. No caf√© either, but there are vendors selling ice-cream, coffee and snacks near the entrance. I could happily spend the whole day here. A lovely place to escape the bustle of the city centre!

‚ÄúA cartwheel-friendly slice of history‚Äù

If you're in York and fancy a stroll through history with a side of flower power, the Museum Gardens are the place to be. Picture this: centuries-old ruins, colourful flower beds, and enough benches to rest your legs (or just to sit and people-watch while eating a suspiciously large ice cream).

You've got tours, a museum, and-most importantly-ample open space to unleash your inner gymnast. Yes, it's entirely possible to do a cartwheel in front of historically significant ruins here, which I'm sure is what the architects intended.

Perfect for a peaceful wind-down after battling the bustling city centre. Well worth a visit‚Ä¶ just mind the ducks, they walk like they own the place.

Gorgeous, peaceful, tranquil and overall calming gardens open for free to the public with plenty of benches, bins, floral areas, walks and places to stop. Outside of the York Museum, it still has the original walls and parts of an old historic building, clearly well looked after and treasured. I found my visit here very nice, it's a great place to take photos and get outside, away from the bustle of the town.

places.address: Museum St, York, YO1 7FR, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: York Castle Museum, located in York, North Yorkshire, offers a unique and immersive experience for visitors to step back in time. The museum features a recreated Victorian street called Kirkgate, complete with authentic shops and costumed guides. It also showcases exhibits on everyday life from different eras, including the 1960s. With interactive displays and the use of modern technology to recreate historical settings, the museum provides an engaging look into York's past.

sources.snippet: The York Castle Museum is a museum located in the former prison buildings of York Castle. It tells the story of York‚Äôs social and cultural history, with exhibits ranging from Victorian street scenes to recreated prison cells. One of the most popular exhibits is the recreated street of Kirkgate, which takes visitors back in time to the Victorian era.
sources.shortName: Things to Do in York for Couples for a Romantic Getaway

sources.snippet: One of the biggest collections of Valentine cards in the UK can also be found in the York Castle Museum. A thousand or more messages of love are in the archives ‚Äì including possibly the oldest printed Valentine‚Äôs card in the world. This was published on 12 January 1797 by John Fairburn of 146 Minories, London.
sources.shortName: Romantic York

sources.snippet: The York Castle Museum is the best place to delve into hundreds of years of York‚Äôs history, all under one roof. From recreated Jacobean dining rooms to toy exhibits from the 20th century, there‚Äôs an impressive array of collections the are likely to cater to most tastes. I was impressed beyond my expectations.
sources.shortName: 16 VERY BEST Things to do in York, England (2023)

sources.snippet: York Castle Museum is also worth a visit as it has one of the largest collections of Valentine cards for you to pore over together. There are more than 1000 declarations of undying love in these beautiful cards dating back to 1797. How sentimental and heartwarming is that?!
sources.shortName: 3 Romantic York Date Ideas To Spice Up Your Love Life

places.name: York Castle Museum

reviews.text: Great place to visit. All the exhibits are so well put together  but particularly loved the Victorian Street with lots of different shops to visit, turning from day to night was a nice touch and the dark history of the prison was gruesome but fascinating. Lovely staff throughout (especially the nice smiley lady in the caf√©!) Would definitely recommend a visit!

Visited on a Monday in the summer holidays, didn't book in advance, turned up at about 10.50am. Slight queue to get in but that's to be expected in the summer holidays. Definitely worth a visit, lots to see, the Victorian street was really interesting with shops you could go in, around the museum at various points there were clothes you could try on. Have been to several museums but not one like this before

This is a lovely museum and worth the visit and extensive history and the streets are amazing. I feel the only reservations I had were that the machines cost money eg 50 per to use which I feel is unfair considering you pay for the entry fee. Plus the confectionery shop was shut and that also was to pay and only cash so it costs extra for other things, the world war exhibition I feel was quite smaller and there could have been better things to do there also. However overall it is a museum worth the effort to do.

places.address: Tower St, York, YO1 9RY, United Kingdom

sources.snippet: The Hilt is a fantastic ice-breaker if you‚Äôre on a first date or nervous about filling the day with conversation. Let down your hair and you‚Äôll soon be giggling like a pair of schoolkids (the minimum age for axe throwing is 13).
sources.shortName: 3 Romantic York Date Ideas To Spice Up Your Love Life
21 romantic things to do in York

places.name: The Hilt

reviews.text:
Absolutely brilliant hour spent with axe trainer Izzy teaching us and our daughter how to throw an accurate axe.

Izzy set us up with some fun games and crafted a competitive spirit between the other families.  The hour flew by, and is well worth the money.

Definitely recommend.
Amazing experience for Eve's hen party! Myles was a fabulous coach and we had such a laugh. I can't thank him enough! X

We booked a coach session today and had a brilliant time! Miles got us all involved, really knew his stuff, had us competing against other but kept it lighthearted and everyone laughing. He even gave extra points for the best battle cry! I will definitely come back again the next time I'm in York. The best axe throwing experience I've had yet!

places.address: 57B Goodramgate, York, YO1 7LS, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the picturesque Yorkshire countryside, Castle Howard is an opulent 18th-century stately home surrounded by landscaped grounds featuring fountains, trails, and lakes. This iconic baroque masterpiece offers visitors a glimpse into over 300 years of history and the lavish lifestyles of the Howard family. With its grand interiors, including the impressive Great Hall and exquisite art collections, Castle Howard is a living estate filled with grandeur and beauty.
places.name: Castle Howard

reviews.text: Lovely day out, the gardens cover a large area so you get your moneys worth. There are pigs in the woods which was my favourite bit. A few decent cafes, nice food. Garden centre next door. Boat rides on the lake. Didn't go in the house as we had our dog with us.  Could have done with better signs to the temple as it wasn't clear which way to go.

If you enjoy a walk round some fabulous gardens, lakes, temples then this is for you. I didn't go in the house as I had a dog with me but the tea rooms, gift shop and farm shop all had something to give you joy.  Really worth a visit.

We will visit again. We went on a whim, booked night before but didn't disappoint. Michael at reception was so friendly and gave us info and how to get around. He was humorous too. So it was a great experience from that right through to the end of the day. Lots to see, we will be back to do more walks around the acres as we didn't fit it all in. The sights were beautiful. reviews.text: Austin was a fantastic guide - knowledgeable, friendly, and full of great stories that made the tour even more enjoyable. The tour itself was informative, interactive, and engaging - and the chocolate tasting was especially enjoyable! Amy's delivery of the tour was equally as engaging, funny, and captivating. The tour was well paced and we felt the experience was good value for money! Staff in the shop were friendly and the variety within the experience was enjoyable. places.generalDescription: York City Walls are remnants of a stonework enclosure around a rectangular fortification, built in 71 CE. York has a rich history dating back to its founding in 71 AD as the capital of the Roman province in Britain. It later became famous for trade and commercial centers during the Middle Ages. The city developed into an important center for rail networks, manufacturing, education, and health services. Today, tourism plays a significant role in the local economy.

sources.snippet: York City Walls next to green grass at sunset, York, England, UK. Kick off your visit with a pleasant wander around York‚Äôs city walls, dating back to the 13th century - you're not the first couple to have done this, then. Covering 3.4 kilometres, these beautifully preserved medieval walls are in fact the most complete in England - you can start the walk from any point in the city, but we recommend the entrance from Barker Tower on the River Ouse.
sources.shortName: Lovely Things to Do in York for Couples

sources.snippet: York City Walls, which encompass the old heart of the city, provide a peaceful yet historically rich environment perfect for a romantic evening stroll. places.name: York City Walls

reviews.text: During my visit to York for the day, my overseas friend and I planned to walk the York City Walls and what a lovely experience it was! Made better by the sunshine and clear, blue skies. There were plenty of things to see along the way, and moments where we were able to stop off, take in our surroundings and simply be still, in the moment. At certain points, there are benches to rest and take in the sights and sounds of York. It was fascinating to try and picture, while walking these walls, what life would have been like back then. I found myself wondering throughout the walk "Who once walked these walls?" "Who were they as a person?" "What were they thinking about?" Of course, along the way, you come across the 'bars' which are great to see (came across one, which I didn't know was a cafe!) Although we didn't go inside, it certainly looked quirky! A great place to stop off, for a drink and maybe a slice of cake, before continuing on the adventure! Definitely a great day out, especially for those into history like myself, as there are information boards along the way, telling you about the history of York. And best of all? It's free! So if you fancy taking in the sights of this ancient city, want to learn more about it, and walk in the footsteps of those before us, then I'd recommend walking the York City Walls.

As one of the most famous attractions in York, visiting the city is one of the essential itineraries when you come here. The entire city wall is divided into four major sections. If you want to visit all four sections of the city wall, you will have to enter and exit the city wall four times at different entrances. During the tour of the city wall, you can appreciate the scenery of York from different angles, including its most famous landmark, York Cathedral. In addition, you will see many people living in the residential areas next to the city. It feels very special to spend the afternoon leisurely like this. If you have time, I suggest you spend some time visiting these four sections of the city wall. You will definitely not regret it.

We did not walk all the city walls, we probably did only half of them. They were rich in history, with some good views, some of the gates were beautiful and glorious. The river, the trees, the lotus and bridges added peace and tranquility to the scenery.

As you go deep into the Dungeon, you‚Äôll meet live actors and see special effects and hear gripping storytelling that bring York‚Äôs murky past to life. reviews.text: Highly recommend. The wine was delicious, I wasn't sure what to pick so the Sommelier asked a few questions then brought me x4 tasters to choose from! We came to celebrate my mums birthday and she absolutely loved it! places.generalDescription: The Bar Convent Living Heritage Centre, also known as the Convent of the Institute of the Blessed Virgin, is a historic site in York that offers a unique experience for visitors. Founded in 1686, it is England's oldest living convent and holds great significance in the country's religious history. The center features local history and religious exhibitions, a library, and a cafe. It also houses a hidden chapel and provides insights into Catholicism's past in England.

sources.snippet: I was surprised this was a budget hotel when I started doing this research ‚Äì I‚Äôve driven past this building many times and assumed it was a big fancy hotel.It turns out, this is actually still a convent with a community of Catholic sisters still living there. It's definitely worth visiting.

This cozy, intimate bar offers an incredible selection of craft beers, cask ales, and unique brews from around the world. The knowledgeable and friendly staff are always happy to recommend something new, making it a great spot for both beer enthusiasts and casual drinkers.

The atmosphere is warm and inviting, with a charming medieval feel that adds to York's historic vibe. Whether you're stopping by for a quick pint or settling in for the evening, Pivni is the perfect place to relax and enjoy quality drinks.

Highly recommend for anyone visiting York.

Very cosy and climatic pub in York. Good choice for a rainy evening. I liked their wine and whisky selection, they should work on their cocktail list. It wasn't very crowded in the evening and I liked that it wasn't very loud. Nice spot overall.

places.address: 6 Patrick Pool, York, YO1 8BB, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Located in the Museum Gardens, the Yorkshire Museum features five galleries that display a wide array of archaeological treasures and rare animals, birds, and fossils. The museum's exhibitions offer a fascinating journey through history, including the Ryedale Hoard with Roman artifacts and a collection showcasing 150 million years of Yorkshire's history. Visitors can explore Roman artifacts, detailed regional history, Iron Age jewelry, extinct species, fossils, and notable pieces like the Viking sword and York Helmet.

sources.snippet: Heading to a museum together might sound a bit like something you when your turn 30, but The Yorkshire Museum actually has a lot of interesting things. There‚Äôs lots about York‚Äôs Roman and Viking heritage if you enjoy history, or you can look at the interactive displays and immersive experiences. Make sure you check out the Roman goddess of love Venus while you‚Äôre here.
sources.shortName: 26 fun and romantic things to do in York for couples

sources.snippet: Another popular option is the Yorkshire Museum, which has some of the finest archaeological and geological collections in Europe. From the underwater creatures that swam when Yorkshire was beneath the sea to a genuine Roman mosaic floor, the museum covers centuries of history.
sources.shortName: 16 VERY BEST Things to do in York, England (2023)

sources.snippet: The Yorkshire Museum is one of the most popular for you to visit. You get to learn on various areas such as; geology, archaeology, biology and astronomy. This is also an awesome place to visit in York when it‚Äôs raining with the typical rainy weather in York.
sources.shortName: 25 BEST THINGS TO DO YORK (And Unusual) 2022 Tourist Attactions

places.name: Yorkshire Museum

reviews.text: Great collection of Roman artifacts found in and around York. Superb mosaic, which visitors can walk on (shoes off!). Other highlights include Anglo-Saxon helmet in basement along with other viking and medieval treasures. Don't miss remains of Middlesbrough meteorite on 1st floor plus the original and very first geological map of the UK created by William 'Strata' Smith.

Our visit to the museum was mainly to see the Viking exhibition. There were a number of very interesting items and it only takes one thing that just triggers your curiosity. For me it was some of the intriguing hordes of coins buried to hide them from Viking the invaders. I also found a battle helmet with engravings a fascinating item to ponder. My only gripe is some places needed better signage.
The Star Carr exhibit was also nicely thought out and a real insight into life in early Britain.

The museum is dated, small and a bit chaotic which is why we felt it was overpriced for what you get. But the vikings exhibition was great, the gardens are lovely and the ruins are also very impressive. You can enjoy a nice picnic after your visit away from the noice of the bussy streets.

places.address: Museum Gardens, Museum Street, York YO1 7FR, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Clifford's Tower, located in the heart of York, is a 13th-century castle keep perched on a grass mound. Originally part of York Castle built by William the Conqueror, it has served as a prison and royal mint before becoming a popular tourist attraction. Visitors can climb to the top for stunning panoramic views of the city and beyond to the North York Moors. The tower offers a glimpse into York's medieval past and is an excellent starting point for exploring the area.

sources.snippet: Clifford‚Äôs Tower was originally a motte, and bailey castle built by William the Conqueror, Clifford‚Äôs Tower served as a prison and royal mint before becoming the popular tourist attraction it is today. Climb to the top of the Tower and take in stunning views; on a clear day, you can see as far as the North York Moors, as one of the few remaining parts of York Castle Clifford‚Äôs Tower offers a glimpse into the city‚Äôs medieval past. After your visit, continue your exploration of the castle by walking along the York City Walls and enjoying the city from a unique perspective.
sources.shortName: Things To Do In York For Couples

sources.snippet: Clifford‚Äôs Tower is a medieval castle that offers a glimpse into York‚Äôs past. The tower was built by William the Conqueror in the 11th century and was used as a prison and a royal mint. Today, you can visit the tower and explore the exhibitions that tell the story of its history.
sources.shortName: Things to Do in York for Couples for a Romantic Getaway

sources.snippet: The characterful Clifford‚Äôs Tower dates back to the Norman period. Constructed as part of York Castle on the orders of William the Conqueror, when he arrived in this Viking capital, the building has a tumultuous history, which is brought to life by entertaining actors.
sources.shortName: The Most Romantic Things to Do in York for Couples (2025)

sources.snippet: Clifford‚Äôs Tower is an imposing sight perched on a mound, watching guard over the city. It is almost all that remains of York Castle, which was built by William the Conqueror in 1068. English Heritage maintains the remains of the tower.
sources.shortName: 15 Romantic Things to do in York for Couples

sources.snippet: Climb the steep set of entrance stairs to the exbibits inside the tower to discover what life was like in Norman times. After this you can climb the stairs up to the circular rooftop for a fantastic 360 degree view of York.
sources.shortName: 21 romantic things to do in York
15 BEST things to do in York for couples in 2024

places.name: Clifford's Tower, York

reviews.text: Beautiful and well kept historic building, a very important piece of York's history and culture, with a very interesting story attached. This is a must see tourist spot for an insight into Yorks past. It offers a gorgeous view from the top of a very steep hill with lots of stairs to the top, however no lift or disabled access, one can only imagine how fun it would be to sled down it in the winter- from the top you can see over the museum and surrounding areas, I believe it to be very beautiful for a sunset‚Ä¶

We're members of English heritage so it didn't cost anything for entry and I must say I'm glad as there's not a lot to see. It was lovely to have a look around cliffords tower and there are things to look at like it's history and the view from the top but not much more. It definitely won't take long and it's quite a pull walking up the very steep steps (55 I think) so you do need to be fit. Give it a look round you may learn something.

It is also a landmark tourist attraction that you cannot miss when you come to York. The fee here is not high, but the tour time is relatively short, about half an hour to nine minutes, and you can visit all the places. The most worthwhile thing about the whole attraction is to go to the top floor of the tower to see the scenery of York town in 360 degrees. In different directions, they will provide signs to remind you of other landmarks you can see. On sunny days, you can come here and sit on the bench to enjoy the sun and appreciate the beautiful scenery of York.

places.address: Tower St, York, YO1 9SA, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Located in the heart of historic York, Cosy Club is a charming and quirky haven with vintage chic decor and an eccentric Victorian parlour ambiance. The mismatched armchairs and eclectic wall art create a unique atmosphere where you can enjoy a lazy brunch, imaginative cocktails, or simply soak in the surroundings. The extensive menu offers options for everyone, including salads, sandwiches, tapas, and burgers. Additionally, they cater to various dietary requirements with large gluten-free and vegan menus.

sources.snippet: For cocktails, try the Evil Eye Lounge on Stonegate (allegedly favoured by Johnny Depp when in town) or the Art Deco Cosy Club on Fossgate.
sources.shortName: 21 romantic things to do in York

places.name: Cosy Club

reviews.text:
What a wonderful surprise on our drive back to London all the way from Edinburgh!

The place used to be a cinema, so the atmosphere is amazing and unique.

The staff was really nice and the food was really good! I don't eat a lot of curry but their chicken curry was superb üëå.

The croquets were also amazing.

Went for breakfast/brunch nice food but not amazing. The bacon was very nice and so was the sourdough, the chorizo beans were also a nice surprise. Sausages were just ok as we're the hash browns. For almost ¬£17 I would have expected better. The drinks were delicious though, the cherry Bakewell cocktail is amazing easily the best I've tried. If you want two decent full English breakfasts and two great cocktails for ¬£60, then you'll find it here, but I can imagine there are cheaper alternatives nearby that are just as good.

Had a very pleasant lunch at the cosy club. Beautiful atmosphere though it was too dark for lunch. I had a coffee and a main and it was over ¬£20, which was quite expensive but my lunch portion was quite large. I had the aubergine and butter bean tagine which was absolutely beautiful but the parsley taste got extremely overpowering and so I couldn't finish it.

Service was very nice - just not anything spectacular!

All in all, would recommended- it is a bit on the pricier side for sure.

places.address: 19-22 Fossgate, York, YO1 9TA, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: The Merchant Adventurers' Hall, a remarkable timber-framed building dating back to the 1350s, stands as one of the oldest guildhalls in Great Britain. It holds historical significance as a hub for merchants engaging in pioneering business ventures that led to substantial wealth. The hall features a grand Great Hall with an oak-beam ceiling on the first floor and showcases its history as a hospital on the ground floor from the 14th to 20th centuries.

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôre looking for things to do in York for couples that will appeal to someone with a sweet tooth, you just can‚Äôt go wrong with an afternoon tea - and this is my favourite place in York to get one. Obviously, in a city like York you‚Äôll find scones, cream and jam galore. But this one is my particular favourite for a few reasons.
sources.shortName: 15+ Things to Do in York for Couples (That You Actually Want to Do)

places.name: Merchant Adventurers' Hall

reviews.text:
We held our wedding at the Hall at the weekend. We hardly needed to decorate it as it is such a special space. The weather was glorious and we spent time in the wonderful gardens.
The staff are amazing, Ricky, Andy and the Beadle Rob. Rob answered so many questions from me in the run up to the wedding, tiny details about table layouts etc, and sound checks. On the day everything was as planned and perfect.
Thank you all for our amazing day. Our guests had the best time.

The aesthetic of the great hall was somewhat dampened by tacky cardboard cutouts, cheap chairs stacked around the place and half baked token kids activities. The rest of the place was nice. Almost period, a few tacky bits bolted on for various reasons.

I think the thing I was missing was the depth of traded and merchant adventure stories.

Really interesting place to visit! The Merchant Adventurers' Hall is a proper bit of history-think it dates back to the 1300s, which is mad when you're walking around inside it.

The upstairs hall was especially cool, with this super wonky floor that you definitely notice while walking-feels like you're slightly on a ship! You can just imagine how many people have walked those same boards over the centuries.

Only small downside was the massive old kitchen fireplace upstairs has been mostly covered over with silverware displays, which is a bit of a shame-it would've been great to see it in all its glory. Still, the building itself and the history behind it are more than worth the visit!

places.address: The Hall, Fossgate, York YO1 9XD, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Hole In The Wall is a traditional red-brick venue offering ales, classic pub food, quizzes, and live music nights. It's located across the street from Bootham Bar, one of the main gates into the old city of York. This gate provides access to a scenic half-mile walk along the medieval walls with lovely views of the town center and modern neighborhoods.

sources.snippet: Experience the wonder of a Harry Potter themed mini-golf adventure at the Hole in the Wand!. With nine enchanting holes spread across two levels, you‚Äôll encounter a few surprises. This activity is perfect for kids, although we noticed quite a few adults on dates like us enjoying the magic.
sources.shortName: Things To Do In York For Couples

places.name: Hole In The Wall

reviews.text: I'd enjoyed good food and hospitality at this pub on previous day trips to York, and this visit was certainly no different! Conveniently located just inside the city walls, between Bootham Bar and the Minster, it's an atmospheric old place with wooden beams, exposed brick walls, cosy lounges, and an intriguing mystery surrounding the discovery, in 1816, of a dungeon and a passage that was hurriedly bricked up after ghostly footsteps were heard there. It's claimed you can occasionally still hear them! Because of the pub's location on a busy and narrow street, there is no outside seating. I found a nice table in the larger lounge at the back, with its quirky modern decor and a choice of seating options. The bar staff were welcoming and friendly, and although the pub filled up very quickly, service was surprisingly quick. Great choice of cask ales, and an extensive gin list on the table, but I opted for a good Merlot. The large menu included grills, burgers, jacket potatoes, a house salad, and traditional main courses. I chose the special: a giant Yorkshire pudding filled with mashed potato, carrots, broccoli, and three slices of roast beef (you can have sausages as an alternative), with a pot of horseradish sauce and rich gravy. The meal was piping hot, well cooked, and very filling. Didn't have room for any of the tempting desserts on offer! Prices were very reasonable. The ambience was lively and friendly. Overall, an ideal place to stop for lunch when sightseeing in York.

One of the best pub experiences I've ever had. There are many draft beer options, which is quite important. I had chicken wings, mac and cheese, and onion rings - all of them were delicious. And of course, you should definitely try the Yorkshire pudding.

I was looking for a cosy pub type environment for a meal with my daughters. We had walked past The Hole in the Wall a few times while visiting York. On the Thursday evening I suggested we call in. It was quite busy (which is always a good sign) but we managed to get a 4 seat table.
The bar staff were very friendly and took our order. Our drinks were brought to us at our table 11. The young lady was very pleasant. The same young lady brought our food too.
I was extremely surprised at the cost of 3 meals with 3 drinks, ¬£69.75. I expected it to be more expensive. It was quite warm in the pub so aircon would have been very useful. However, a nice meal was had by all, and I would definitely visit again if in York.

places.address: High Petergate, York, YO1 7EH, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of York, Corner Grill House is a charming restaurant that promises an unforgettable dining experience. With its cozy interiors and inviting ambiance, it‚Äôs the perfect spot for both romantic dinners and family gatherings. The menu features a delightful selection of √† la carte and fixed-price grill platters that are sure to tantalize your taste buds. Guests rave about the engaging staff who go above and beyond to make you feel at home, creating a warm atmosphere where conversations flow easily between courses.

sources.snippet: The Corner Grill House is an award-winning restaurant in York that you might easily overlook. However, missing out on this gem would be a mistake. Despite recently expanding their premises, The Corner Grill House has managed to maintain the warm and intimate atmosphere of their original restaurant.
sources.shortName: Things to Do in York for Couples for a Romantic Getaway

places.name: Corner Grill House

reviews.text:
Went for dinner a few weeks back with my partner, I chose this restaurant as it had good reviews. And I can see why! It was absolutely amazing!

I had the lamb with mint gravy, horseradish mash and carrots. It was so delicious I enjoyed every mouthful!

My partner had the Cajun chicken with crispy new potatoes and broccoli. He said the sauce was amazing and the chicken was cooked perfectly.
I can't complement it enough!

The desserts were amazing as well! We had the sticky toffee pudding and the chocolate brownie. The only thing I questioned was the sticky toffee pudding wasn't heated up but the brownie was which I thought should be the other way or both warm instead. That was the only thing I can think of I would change it was all amazing I would definitely recommend if you're in York to eat here! I wish I lived closer so I can eat here all the time!

What a gem! Very spacious but the decor and layout manages to make the space feel cosy.
Great menu with a lot of choice and the options chosen didn't disappoint - a selection of starters to share for our group, followed by the fish of the day (cod) and the apple crumble for dessert.

De-li-cious !!

The entire staff were brilliant but I must make a special mention.
Our waitress, Mariam, was simply outstanding, a petit powerhouse! Attentive from the start and even though we had a big, perhaps a little boisterous, group, she held her own and managed to get through ordering, clearing the table between courses, navigating the humour and random interactions beautifully. Five star service ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

It's a nice place, not extortionately expensive and the food is good though not great. This place obviously gets good reviews and I suppose that left us little disappointed in the food. The starters were both ok, 6/10. The steak was also ok. We went to flat iron in London recently and their steak was both nicer and cheaper, so I'm really judging against that. I opted for the mash, which was nice but not very smooth. Having tried the chips they were definitely the better option. The red wine sauce was great but it was the dessert that was the star, the apples in the apple crumble were just the right softness and I have to say its one of the nicest apple crumbles I've ever had. The drinks menu was a little limited on the cocktail front and the margarita was very heavily salted, almost like drinking the sea at times. All in all a nice restaurant, but one that left us slightly underwhelmed. It is quite small, so I would book in advance.

places.address: 12a King St, York, YO1 9SP, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Located just north of York Minster, the National Trust-owned Treasurer's House is a well-preserved 17th-century residence filled with furniture, ceramics, textiles, and paintings. Originally built over a Roman road and later redesigned in the early 17th century, it showcases a mix of architectural styles. The house holds historical significance as the former residence of Frank Green, an influential figure in York.

sources.snippet: The grand historic house of Treasurer‚Äôs House is tucked behind York Minster. Now owned and maintained by the National Trust, the house and gardens welcome visitors through the spring and summer months. This historic building was bought by Frank Green in 1897.
sources.shortName: 15 Romantic Things to do in York for Couples

sources.snippet: Treasurer‚Äôs House is a historic townhouse located in the heart of York. It was built in the late 19th century and is now owned by the National Trust. Visitors can explore the house and its beautiful gardens, as well as learn about its fascinating history.
sources.shortName: Things to Do in York for Couples for a Romantic Getaway

places.name: National Trust - Treasurer's House, York

reviews.text: This house is guided tour only so if you want to visit at a specific time, book in advance. Otherwise pop in and book a slot then go off and do something else. Very well orchestrated tours with good information and stories. Beautiful rooms. Extensive cafe in the basement.

Tuesday 20th May
Nice gardens and house, with so much history.
Tours of the house need to be booked but are worth doing, takes about an hour, you can always book and come back for the allocated time, plenty of places to go and see while you wait.
Really knowledgeable guides Elaine & Barbara, lots of information and interesting back stories.
Cafe and toilets on site, and the treasurer's house is right in the centre of York next to the Minster.

A great house to look around full of interesting fact and wonder.
I was booked onto a guided tour and the guides were very friendly and full of knowledge about the house.
The house was a lot bigger than I expected and is situated right at the back of York Minster.

places.address: Minster Yard, York, YO1 7JL, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Evil Eye Lounge in York is a whimsical and enchanting bar that offers an extensive menu of creative cocktails, smoothies, and milkshakes. Tucked away on York's oldest street, this quirky gin shop and cocktail bar boasts unique decor and a vast selection of both classic and modern cocktails. The lounge's mystical and mischievous vibe creates a celestial experience for visitors, with mesmerizing wall decorations that inspire curiosity.

sources.snippet: There‚Äôs also a good selection of cocktail bars, including Evil Eye Lounge, which is hidden behind a speciality gin store. And don‚Äôt forget to go for a Sunday Roast and try a famous Yorkshire pudding!. The Lamb & Lion was Jess‚Äôs recommendation, and we can attest to its greatness.
sources.shortName: 16 VERY BEST Things to do in York, England (2023)

sources.snippet: For cocktails, try the Evil Eye Lounge on Stonegate (allegedly favoured by Johnny Depp when in town) or the Art Deco Cosy Club on Fossgate.
sources.shortName: 21 romantic things to do in York

places.name: Evil Eye

reviews.text: We came for my birthday! Delicious cocktails - the Fleetwood CaraMac was very good! Staff were so friendly, welcoming and knowledgeable. Loved the upstairs comfy seating too. Would recommend a visit!

Popped into Evil Eye to try one of their cocktails - prices are around ¬£10 each, which is pretty standard. The atmosphere inside is really cool and laid-back, and the bar opens out into a charming little courtyard, which adds to the vibe. One of the staff members was especially friendly and helpful, even giving me some great recommendations on places to check out in York. Top-notch customer service and a great spot for a drink if you're in the ci

Evil Eye cocktail bar in York is a must-visit destination for anyone looking to enjoy an exceptional drinking experience. Renowned for its impressive selection of spirits and cask ales, this bar delivers a unique ambiance that perfectly complements its creative cocktail menu.

One of the standout features of Evil Eye is its "one drink policy," which encourages patrons to savor each carefully crafted cocktail rather than indulging in excessive drinking. The Evil Empress cocktail is particularly noteworthy, known for its intriguing combination of flavors and eye-catching presentation. This cocktail, alongside many others, showcases the bar's commitment to quality and creativity in mixology.

The decor of Evil Eye is another highlight. With a blend of eclectic and stylish elements, the space is designed to create a vibrant atmosphere that invites guests to relax and enjoy their drinks. The thoughtful decor contributes to the overall experience, making it a visually appealing venue.

The staff at Evil Eye are not only knowledgeable but also friendly and attentive, enhancing the overall experience with their excellent service. They are always ready to offer recommendations or customize drinks to suit individual preferences, making every visit feel personal and welcoming.

Interestingly, the bar has gained a bit of celebrity status, as it is said to be a favorite spot for Johnny Depp when he visits the UK. This adds to the allure of Evil Eye, making it a trendy spot for both locals and visitors.

In summary, Evil Eye cocktail bar is a fantastic choice for those looking to explore a diverse range of spirits and cocktails in a stylish setting. With its great decor, attentive staff, and a reputation for quality, it truly stands out as a gem in York's nightlife scene. Whether you're a cocktail enthusiast or simply looking for a great place to unwind, Evil Eye is definitely worth a visit.

places.address: 42 Stonegate, York, YO1 8AS, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: The Cat's Whiskers cafe in Goodramgate offers cats and cappuccinos, with the aim of helping to find homes for the animals. The cafe also sells a range of baked treats, as well as providing light lunches and afternoon teas.

sources.snippet: As a cat lover it was a no-brainer to visit The Cat‚Äôs Whiskers Cat Cafe in York. There‚Äôs something very relaxing, after a couple of hours walking York city walls, about having a coffee surrounded by cute bundles of fluff. The Cat Cafe is so popular you are advised to book a time slot when you want to visit.
sources.shortName: 7 Things To Do In York For Couples

places.name: The Cat's Whiskers

reviews.text:
If you're a cat lover you MUST visit this cute little cat cafe. It was our first time in York and we didn't know York is called ‚Äúthe city of cats‚Äù but we were thrilled to walk past this place! We were able to secure a walk in spot with only an hours notice which gave us a little time to explore the area. They have over 20 cats here, all of which are extremely adorable. The smoothies, tea, cake, and scones were delicious too! The cake portions are huge so be prepared, but every bite was fantastic. We especially loved Pumpkin, the fluffy orange cat who was very eager to try and snag a bite of our snacks üòÇ
Love this place and the work they do for the local cats. üíó

I took my daughter today for her birthday üéÇ First time for both of us. Greeted by snowy a white fluffy cat in the waiting area who loved the strokes. All of the cats were very content and sleeping. The carrot cake was amazing ü§§ The staff were welcoming and happy to tell us about the cats. The highlight was Pumkin coming to sit on our knees!! Would definitely go back and highly recommend üëå

My partner and I came here and managed to luckily secure a space without booking an appointment. Super exciting as we've never been to a cat cafe before and we are glad we made this one our first one. The staff were lovely, we both had a latte and it was really good. Cats are absolutely gorgeous and the cafe itself was amazing with all the cat walls etc.

places.address: 46 Goodramgate, York, YO1 7LF, United Kingdom
